member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.FileHelper.ModifyText(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Modifies text content by supporting line deletion, insertion, or updating through a combination of both.
member.param: The text to operate on.
The 1-based line number indicating where the operation begins. For insertion, this is the line where the new content will be added before.

The number of lines to delete starting from the line number specified by "startLine" Set to 0 for insertion operations where existing lines are not to be removed. To delete all lines from the start line, use the maximum value of the integer type.
The content to insert. For deletion operations, this should be set to null. For update operations, this contains the new content replacing the deleted lines.
member.returns: Modified text.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than 1 or is negative.

member.summary: Modifies text content within a file by supporting line deletion, insertion, or updating through a combination of both.
member.param: The full path to the text file to operate on.
The 1-based line number indicating where the operation begins. For insertion, this is the line where the new content will be added before.

The number of lines to delete starting from the line number specified by "startLine" Set to 0 for insertion operations where existing lines are not to be removed. To delete all lines from the start line, use the maximum value of the integer type.
The content to insert into the file. For deletion operations, this should be set to null. For update operations, this contains the new content replacing the deleted lines.
member.returns: A string indicating the outcome of the operation. Returns "OK" if successful.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than 1 or is negative.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.Multimedia
member.summary: TTS functions, in combination with Jocys.com TTS Monitor app (Jocys.com/TTS), allow AI to speak and narrate stories or dialogues using text-to-speech voices. Works well with Windows Voice Typing. Enable text-to-speech: AI Companion > Enable all TTS plugins in this tab. Add message instruction for AI like "Answer with text-to-speech voice." TTS Monitor > [Options] tab > [Monitor: Server] tab > check "Enable" checkbox. TTS Monitor > [Options] tab > [Monitor: Display] tab > uncheck "Enable" checkbox.

Multimedia, encompassing Text (as symbolic representations), Audio (as pressure waves), and Video (as electromagnetic waves), should be addressed through unified methods, given the prevalence of files that integrate text, audio, and video components.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.Multimedia.AISpeakCallback
member.summary: Will be used by plugins manager and called by AI.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.Multimedia.AISpeak(System.String,System.Nullable{JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.TtsMonitor.VoiceGender},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Triggers the AI Avatar to articulate the provided text through speech synthesis. This function must be used by the AI whenever it is required to speak or respond to user queries. This direct association with the AI's speech mechanism ensures that all verbal outputs adhere to a consistent and controlled format. This funtion utilizing Microsoft Azure Speech Service, compatible with Speech Synthesis Markup Language Version 1.0 (SSML 1.0). Use SSML for the input text when supported by the language to refine speech traits such as tone, pitch, and pace for more natural and expressive output.
member.param: String that the AI is expected to vocalize.
(optional) Character gender: 'Male', 'Female', 'Neutral'. Default: 'Male'. Default is set by the user.
(optional) Language Culture. Use Language[-Location] format. For example: 'en-GB'. Default is set by the user.
(optional) Text format is the SSML-formatted string. Default is auto.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.Multimedia.PlayText(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.TtsMonitor.VoiceGender},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Start playing text. This could be used for speaking with the user or narrating books or stories.
member.param: Character name.
Text to play.
Character gender: 'Male', 'Female', 'Neutral'. Default: 'Male'.
Language Culture. Use Language[-Location] format. For example: 'en-GB'. Default is set by the user.
Sound effects: 'Default', 'Beast', 'Demon', 'Dragonkin', 'Elemental', 'Giant', 'Humanoid', 'Mechanical', 'Undead'. Default is 'Default' for humans.
Message chat group: 'Quest'. Default: 'Quest'.
Voice pitch: Range from -10 to 10. Default is set by the user.
Voice rate or speed: Range from -10 to 10. Default is set by the user.
Voice volume. Range from 0 to 100. Default is set by the user.
member.returns: True if the operation was successful.

member.summary: Stop text-to-speech playback.

member.summary: Search an index and return search results.

Search string.

member.summary: Searches the Windows Index for files matching the specified criteria. This method allows for extensive search capabilities, including text content, file metadata, and more.
member.param: Contents of the file. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The name of the item, typically the file name including the extension. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The full path of the item, suitable for display to the user. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
A text description of the item type, e.g., "JPEG image". Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The file extension of the item. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The minimum size of the item, in bytes.
The maximum size of the item, in bytes.
The author of the document. Applicable to documents that store this metadata. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The title of the document. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
Any comment associated with the file. Uses CONTAINS in the query for partial matching.
The start date for when the item was created.
The end date for when the item was created.
The start date for when the item was last modified.
The end date for when the item was last modified.
The start date for when the item was last accessed.
The end date for when the item was last accessed.
member.returns: A list of objects that match the specified search criteria.
member.remarks: This method leverages the Windows Search Index, offering a powerful search functionality across various file properties. For properties like dates and size, where partial matching isn't applicable, the method uses SQL expressions to define ranges.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.DiffHelper
member.summary: Diff helper.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.DiffHelper.PatchText(System.String,JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch[])
member.summary: Updates the content of the text by applying a series of changes. These changes must be represented using the unified diff format, which is focused on efficient text manipulation. This format supports insertions, deletions, and modifications, particularly useful when bandwidth or storage is limited. The unified diff format is derived from the Myers Diff Algorithm, as implemented by Google's Diff Match and Patch library.
member.param: The text contents that needs to be updated.
Unified diff string representing the changes to apply, adhering to the Eugene W.Myers AnO(ND) Difference Algorithm implemented by The Diff Match and Patch library.
member.returns: 'OK' if the operation was successful; otherwise, an error message.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.DiffOperation
member.summary: Represents a single difference operation between two sets of text.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.DiffOperation.Operation
member.summary: The type of operation performed: INSERT (to add text), DELETE (to remove text), or EQUAL (indicating no change).

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.DiffOperation.TextContent
member.summary: The text content associated with this operation. For INSERT, this is the text to be added; for DELETE, it's the text to be removed; and for EQUAL, it's the text that remains unchanged.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.IDiffHelper
member.summary: Diff helper.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.IDiffHelper.CompareFilesAndReturnChanges(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two files and returns a textual representation of the changes by using Eugene W.Myers AnO(ND) Difference Algorithm implemented by Google's The Diff Match and Patch library. This format is focused on efficient text manipulation, supporting insertions, deletions, and modifications, especially useful when bandwidth or storage is limited.
member.param: The path to the original file.
The path to the modified file.
member.returns: Unified diff string detailing the changes made from the original file to the modified file.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.IDiffHelper.CompareContentsAndReturnChanges(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two contents and returns a textual representation of the changes by using Eugene W.Myers AnO(ND) Difference Algorithm implemented by Google's The Diff Match and Patch library. This format is focused on efficient text manipulation, supporting insertions, deletions, and modifications, especially useful when bandwidth or storage is limited.
member.param: Original content.
Modified content.
member.returns: Unified diff string detailing the changes made from the original content to the modified content.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.IDiffHelper.ModifyFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the content of the file by applying a series of changes. These changes must be represented using the unified diff format, which is focused on efficient text manipulation. This format supports insertions, deletions, and modifications, particularly useful when bandwidth or storage is limited. The unified diff format is derived from the Myers Diff Algorithm, as implemented by Google's Diff Match and Patch library.
member.param: The path to the file that needs to be updated.
Unified diff string representing the changes to apply, adhering to the Eugene W.Myers AnO(ND) Difference Algorithm implemented by Google's The Diff Match and Patch library.
member.returns: 'OK' if the operation was successful; otherwise, an error message.
member.example:
The GNU Unified Diff Format example:
@@ -OriginalStart,OriginalLength +TargetStart,TargetLength @@ -TextToDelete +TextToInsert
Placeholders: - OriginalStart is the 1-based starting line number of the original text segment. - OriginalLength is the number of lines in the original text segment affected by the patch. - TargetStart is the 1-based starting line number in the transformed (target) text where changes begin. - TargetLength is the number of lines in the transformed text resulting from the patch. - TextToDelete is the original text to be removed. - TextToInsert is the new text to be added.

member.name: M:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.IDiffHelper.ModifyContents(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the content of the file by applying a series of changes. These changes must be represented using the unified diff format, which is focused on efficient text manipulation. This format supports insertions, deletions, and modifications, particularly useful when bandwidth or storage is limited. The unified diff format is derived from the Myers Diff Algorithm, as implemented by Google's Diff Match and Patch library.
member.param: The contents that needs to be updated.
Unified diff string representing the changes to apply, adhering to the Eugene W.Myers AnO(ND) Difference Algorithm implemented by The Diff Match and Patch library.
member.returns: 'OK' if the operation was successful; otherwise, an error message.
member.example:
The GNU Unified Diff Format example:
@@ -OriginalStart,OriginalLength +TargetStart,TargetLength @@ -TextToDelete +TextToInsert
Placeholders: - OriginalStart is the 1-based starting line number of the original text segment. - OriginalLength is the number of lines in the original text segment affected by the patch. - TargetStart is the 1-based starting line number in the transformed (target) text where changes begin. - TargetLength is the number of lines in the transformed text resulting from the patch. - TextToDelete is the original text to be removed. - TextToInsert is the new text to be added.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.OperationType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of operations that can be performed in a diff operation. These operations are key to understanding how one piece of text can be transformed into another.

member.name: F:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.OperationType.DELETE
member.summary: Delete operation: Specifies that the associated text should be removed from the original text. This operation subtracts text from the target document.

member.name: F:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.OperationType.INSERT
member.summary: Insert operation: Indicates that the associated text should be inserted into the original text. This operation adds text to the target document.

member.name: F:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.OperationType.EQUAL
member.summary: Equal operation: Denotes that the associated text remains unchanged between the original and target texts. This operation signals no modification to the text at this segment.

member.name: T:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch
member.summary: Represents a single patch operation, which is a cohesive set of differences (diffs) applied to transform one piece of text into another. This structure is central to efficiently conveying updates between versions of a text document.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch.Operations
member.summary: An array of diff operations that collectively define the transformation required to patch the text. Each element in this array represents a single change operation to be applied in sequence.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch.OriginalStart
member.summary: The 1-based starting position in the original text where the patching begins. The numbering starts from 1, following the conventional human counting system, marking the beginning of the text segment to be patched.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch.TargetStart
member.summary: The 1-based starting position in the target text where the result of the patching operation begins to apply. This helps align the patch operations correctly with the target text.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch.OriginalLength
member.summary: The total number of characters from the original text that are encompassed by the patch. This length covers the exact segment within the original text that is affected by the applied patch.

member.name: P:JocysCom.VS.AiCompanion.Plugins.Core.UnifiedFormat.TextPatch.TargetLength
member.summary: The total number of characters in the target or resultant text after the patch has been applied. This reflects the length of the text segment resulting from the transformation.
